title: Wishmaster

quote: Rarely has so much of so little consequence been so closely examined.

quote: The bright, crisp design, Wilde's arch eloquence and a classy company help to camouflage the shortcomings.

quote: An enjoyable, minor, lustrously shot revamping of Oscar Wilde's play about the perpetually interlocked manners of love and deception.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: Smooth-flowing direction, a shrewdly pruned script and a top-flight ensemble cast that visibly relishes both the dialogue and one another's perfs make this a tony item for upscale, mature audiences.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: Parker has made a sensible cinematic translation of Wilde's play, intercutting scenes which would have been played consecutively on the stage.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: [I]t's likely that Mr. Wilde, who once wrote, 'A poet can survive anything but a misprint,' would have been less than thrilled with the result.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: Wilde was always about lots more than witty repartee, and as sparkling as his play is as drawing-room comedy, it reveals his concern with the timeless values of unselfish love and forgiveness.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: [T]his Husband plods and ambles and bears the burden of a soundtrack that resembles a wimpy meditation tape.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: Much of the four acts of An Ideal Husband, a serious comedy, is constructed out of flip one-liners, most of which remain, though Parker has added a few, all unworthy of the master.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: An irresistible concoction of brilliant dialogue, sumptuous set design, top-notch acting, and a plot littered with Machiavellian twists.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: An Ideal Husband works because Wilde created an expert mechanism (kind of slow-motion serious screwball comedy) for manipulating the plot and characters.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: Our familiarity with the actors, and their comfort in this period setting, lend the piece an unexpected air of naturalism.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: Parker, who himself adapted Wilde's play for the movie, takes what to purists may be an unforgivable number of liberties with the story, fleshing out the plot and even adding dialogue.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: [The] film is hardly memorable, but it's amusing enough for two hours, and it never panders or cloys.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: In adapting the play, Mr. Parker has streamlined and rewritten Wilde's dialogue, keeping some (but not all) of Wilde's biting epigrams and scraping off a lot (perhaps too much) of the Victorian crust.
title: An Ideal Husband

quote: Frank Marshall's sophisticated feature directing debut never indulges in ultimate gross-out effects and carefully chooses both its victims and its means of depicting their dispatch.

quote: Frank Marshall, a constant Spielberg collaborator, makes his directorial debut in this genial horror movie, a sweet infestation that creeps and crawls but wouldn't scare anybody.

quote: [An] inspired, self-referential animated musical.

title: South Park: Bigger Longer & Uncut

quote: The movie is exhausting, utterly without feeling, and pointless -- though Smith looks great in his Western outfit.

title: Wild Wild West

title: Wild Wild West

title: Wild Wild West

quote: Unfortunately, Smith's abundant charm is squandered by making him play second fiddle to a bunch of dumb machines that look like rejected maquettes from a Star Wars brainstorming session.
title: Wild Wild West

quote: For maximum entertainment, a movie can't afford to waste so much time being its own carnival barker, relentlessly trying to drum up interest.

quote: A Smith blockbuster is as much a Fourth of July tradition as parades, barbecue picnics and patriotic speeches, but Wild Wild West is a wet firecracker.
title: Wild Wild West

quote: Forget all the ruinously expensive special effects. They're not worth a minute of your time, much less two hours of mind-boggling mediocrity.

quote: [Wild Wild West] is this year's Godzilla, Avengers and Spice World all rolled into one. It's the disappointment of the summer, the worst TV adaptation in recent memory and, almost needless to say, a fiasco of cosmic proportions.

quote: The credits for Wild Wild West are mostly exemplary, and yet the screenplay is swill.

quote: Sonnenfeld's cheerful irreverence keeps it reasonable.

quote: Ghostbusters is primarily a showcase for Murray, who slinks through the movie muttering his lines in his usual cheeky fashion and getting off an occasionally hilarious crack that proves he's thoroughly enjoying himself.

quote: There is more attention to special effects than to humor.
